<@211091239112671234> - I am trying to snap sync geth from besu, but I am consistently disconnecting with this error (which seems unrelated to snap): `not enough non-genesis headers delivered`

trying to get more detail, I have enabled a handful of trace level logs:
```
> debug.vmodule("downloader=5")
null
> debug.vmodule("snap=5")
null
> debug.vmodule("eth=5")
null
> debug.vmodule("p2p=5")
```

but I can't seem to get output for this peer debug log in skeleton.go:818 : 
`peer.log.Debug("Invalid non-genesis header count", "have", len(headers), "want", requestHeaders)`

where does that log line go and how can I enable it ?

author: suburbandad_
content: NVM - it seems the console session was stale.  Since the return is null when changing the logger it wasn't clear it wasn't issuing the log change.  After restarting geth console and re-issuing the log commands I am seeing the output.

author: suburbandad_
content:
weird.  besu is defaulting to a maximum header response size of 192.  Are the max response sizes documented somewhere?  I notice we are capping block bodies at 128, receipts at 256, etc:
https://github.com/hyperledger/besu/blob/main/ethereum/eth/src/main/java/org/hyperledger/besu/ethereum/eth/EthProtocolConfiguration.java#L26-L34
